    • Method Detail

      • stringToList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> stringToList(java.lang.String string,
                                                            java.lang.String delimiter)

        stringToList splits a string into parts that are seperated by a given delimiter into List elements

        Parameters:
        string - the string to be split, for example "abc,def,xyz"
        delimiter - The delimiting string.
        Returns:
        a List with all the elements as String

      • stringToStringArray

        public static java.lang.String[] stringToStringArray(java.lang.String string,
                                                     java.lang.String delimiter)

        stringToList splits a string into parts that are seperated by a given delimiter into String Array elements

        Parameters:
        string - the string to be split, for example "abc,def,xyz"
        delimiter - The delimiting string.
        Returns:
        a String[] with all the seperate elements

      • stringToIntegerArray

        public static java.lang.Integer[] stringToIntegerArray(java.lang.String string,
                                                       java.lang.String delimiter)

        stringToList splits a string into parts that are seperated by a given delimiter into Integer Array elements

        Parameters:
        string - the string to be split, for example "7,11,13"
        delimiter - The delimiting string.
        Returns:
        a Integer[] with all the seperate elements

      • trimEmptyToNull

        public static java.lang.String trimEmptyToNull(java.lang.String string)

        Trims a string and if the end result is "", it returns null. This method is especially useful if you run into the following browser and/or servlet engine bug: when a checkbox is changed from checked to unchecked, the returned value is not null but " " (netscape) or "" (internet explorer).

        Parameters:
        string - the String to be trimmed
        Returns:
        the trimmed String or null if the trimmed result is ""

      • substitute

        public static java.lang.String substitute(java.lang.String in,
                                          java.lang.String find,
                                          java.lang.String newString)

        substitute returns a string in which 'find' is substituted by 'newString'

        Parameters:
        in - String to edit
        find - string to match
        newString - string to substitude for find
        Returns:
        The edited string

      • lastPackageSegment

        public static java.lang.String lastPackageSegment(java.lang.String fullClassName)

        function returns the part of the string after the last period

        Parameters:
        fullClassName - The full class name, including the package name
        Returns:
        The class name (= part behind the last dot)
